synopsis: In this solo episode, Devam shares his transformative journey after quitting his job, exploring themes of self-discovery, creativity, and the importance of taking breaks. He reflects on the pressures of modern life, the joy of DJing, and the value of connecting with oneself to find true fulfillment.
quotes: Sometimes it takes an incredible amount of courage and privilege to take that leap into something unknown.
We're not on this planet to slave away and be like productivity monkeys creating value for our bosses.
If I go back to software, I want to do it because I like it.
The goal of this break is to learn how to breathe.
It's not about the results; it's about the process.
I felt so much self-inflicted pressure to make progress on all these different things.
You should get maybe good at one or two things at a time.
If someone doesn't reciprocate, it does not mean that you got played or that the experience wasn't worth anything.
Your time and your energy are valuable.
I just thought it was so beautiful to meet people taking gap years, exploring cultures, and immersing themselves in the world.
